COLLECTION: Colorado School of Mines Ransome Collection
COORDINATES_SOURCE: 1) Colorado School of Mines collection; 2) Mineral Resource Deposit Database Deposit ID 10310387, deposit, M. Granitto
SAMPLE_DESC: Altered andesite dike cutting quartz monzonite; dike is cut by a major fault, as evidenced by slickenlines on sericite within the dike; dike contains abundant chrysocolla and Cu wad along contacts and structures; more pervasive alteration than in Yer 9, likely due to fluid infiltration along the fault that cuts the dike; high grade Cu ore; this sample is a mix of very friable cobble-like fragments and maybe a microbreccia in contact with either a mottled quartz vein or felsic igneous rock; the breccia is open and extremely propus and contains microscopic pyrite and chalcopyrite blebs; extensive alteration of the sulfides has produced green copper silicates (chrysocolla) and manganese and hydrous iron oxide staining; the breccia has a very friable, sandy texture

SAMPLE_DESC: Two samples (polished thin section?); avery complex assemblage of different minerals; four photos were taken to show areas of sampling for XRD; photo 1 shows general view of one of three specimens making up sample; shown is half of specimen that is comprised of a white massive mineral (manganoan calcite) containing flecks and flakes of metallic native copper; other half of specimen is comprised of very dark brown to black massive mineral(s), hetaerolite and Mn stained clay; photo 2 shows the pinkish orange short wave UV light fluorescence of the manganoan calcite; photo 3 shows sample 25,201a where a scraping of one of the dark minerals was taken for XRD; this area of the specimen is quite soft (easily scratched with pin) and is greyish brown in color; the scraping is on the right side of specimen (MnO2 stained kaolinite); photo 4 shows sample 25201b where a scraping of another dark mineral observed just above the first scraping on the right side of specimen; this material is much harder (not scratched with a pin) and the powdered material is darker brown than the powder from sample 25201a (hetaerolite (zinc-hausmannite)); under reflected light, the darker areas of these specimen show 3 zones or veins of the softer material and 2 zones or vein of the harder material; referring back to photo 1, an XRD scraping of one of the black dendrites (center one ) was taken for mineral ID (hetaerolite); this is labeled as 25,201c; these dendrites are located in the white area of the specimen; combined sulfide and metallic copper approx 1%

COORDINATES_SOURCE: 1) Exact sampling coordinates, converted from UTM to Decimal using the WGS84 Map Datum at www.rcn.montana.edu/resources/tools/coordinates, M. Bennett
SAMPLE_DESC: Volcaniclastic (?) bleached white rock with apparent darker clasts; albite-magnetite(?); main intrusive contact <250 m; patches of fine grain magnetite in light colored altered igneous(?) rock

COLLECTION: Colorado School of Mines Ransome Collection
COORDINATES_SOURCE: 1) Colorado School of Mines collection; 2) Mineral Resource Deposit Database Deposit ID 10199260, ore body, M. Granitto; district from McLemore, V.T., 2017, Mining districts and prospect areas in New Mexico: New Mexico Bureau of Geology and Mineral Resources: Resource Map 24, 65 p., scale 1:1,000,000
SAMPLE_DESC: Skarn with hydrocarbon; misnumbered after sectioning to 0-5 and 0-4; six samples; this sample is comprised of 4 pieces; three photos taken of this sample; photo "a" is a general overall view of a single piece which is heavily banded with a dark red material (Si as determined by SEM, amorphous as determined by XRD); small pods of pyrite are scattered throughout this layer with the thin veinlets and fracture fills of calcite and gypsum; the white layer is a mix of calcite and quartz with scattered blebs of pyrite; the remainder of the piece is a microbrecciated(?) mixture of calcite, quartz and inclusions of the red Si; scattered in this layer is pyrite and chalcopyrite; photo "b" is a photomicrograph showing the red Si substance mixed with pyrite; photo "c" is of the other rock type found in this sample (3 pieces) which consist of massive magnetite, some garnet with widely scattered chalcopyrite

COLLECTION: Colorado School of Mines Ransome Collection

COLLECTION: Colorado School of Mines Ransome Collection

SAMPLE_DESC: Altered footwall schist; altered footwall quartz-phlogopite schist below 300m level; main ore locally has cordierite-andalusite-staurolite-garnet-biotite; essentially an Al, Mg-silicate rock with very sparse widely scattered microscopic pyrite; sulfide <1%

COLLECTION: Colorado School of Mines Ransome Collection
COORDINATES_SOURCE: 1) Colorado School of Mines collection; 2) Mineral Resource Deposit Database Deposit ID 10304268, ore body, M. Granitto
SAMPLE_DESC: Two pieces of well banded Canal type ore; good pyrite vs sphalerite layers (beds are massive); only approximately 4m wide here, ranges up to 10m wide on deeper levels; 7.5% Zn, 2.8% Pb, low Ag and Au; roughly banded or zoned, coarsely granular sphalerite and pyrite; small amount of quartz; sulfide approx 90+%

COLLECTION: Colorado School of Mines Ransome Collection
COORDINATES_SOURCE: 1) Colorado School of Mines collection; 2) Mineral Resource Deposit Database Deposit ID 10304268, ore body, M. Granitto
SAMPLE_DESC: Piece of massive sulfide ore with coarse breccia inclusions(?); Strand orebody; massive pyrite with lesser amounts of chalcopyrite, galena and sphalerite in biotite schist; sulfide approx 70%

COLLECTION: Colorado School of Mines Ransome Collection

SAMPLE_DESC: Two small pieces and one large slab, photo 17 cent of this orebody; very coarse porphyroblastic pyrite in galena skarn ore; massive ill-defined pyrrhotite vein in fibrous calc-silicate rock; sulfide approx 30%

COLLECTION: Colorado School of Mines Ransome Collection

COLLECTION: Colorado School of Mines Ransome Collection

SAMPLE_DESC: Massive magnetite-hematite-chalcopyrite ore; rock is coarsely fragmented and very siliceous; trace-weak CaF2; solid massive magnetite with chalcopyrite and pyrite inclusions; minor calcite with quartz; sulfide approx 10%

COLLECTION: Colorado School of Mines Ransome Collection
COORDINATES_SOURCE: 1) Colorado School of Mines collection; 2) Mineral Resource Deposit Database Deposit ID 10280670, orebody, M. Granitto

COORDINATES_SOURCE: 1) Colorado School of Mines collection; 2) Mineral Resource Deposit Database Deposit ID 10280670, orebody, M. Granitto

COLLECTION: Colorado School of Mines Ransome Collection
COORDINATES_SOURCE: 1) Colorado School of Mines collection; 2) Open-File Report 2017-1079 ID 549, mine, M. Granitto
SAMPLE_DESC: Antlerite-chalcocite-copper wad-calcite veins;numerous veins and veinlets of brochatite, possibly atacamite, with malachite; in quartz and K, Al-silicate rock matrix; brecciated; glue line cuts across the full specimen; possibly isolated patches of chalcocite in several of the major veins

COLLECTION: Colorado School of Mines Ransome Collection
COORDINATES_SOURCE: 1) Colorado School of Mines collection; 2) Open-File Report 2017-1079 ID 549, mine, M. Granitto

COLLECTION: Colorado School of Mines Ransome Collection

COORDINATES_SOURCE: 1) Colorado School of Mines collection; 2) Mineral Resource Deposit Database Deposit ID 10303158, ore body, M. Granitto
SAMPLE_DESC: Black, highly organic shale with tiny to microscopic pyrite widely scattered throughout; some fine banding; also massive fine grain pyrite banding; sulfide approx 30%; highly calcareous; dehydration cracks prominent

COLLECTION: Colorado School of Mines Ransome Collection
COORDINATES_SOURCE: 1) Colorado School of Mines collection; 2) Mineral Resource Deposit Database Deposit ID 10303158, ore body, M. Granitto

COLLECTION: Colorado School of Mines Ransome Collection

COLLECTION: Colorado School of Mines Ransome Collection
COORDINATES_SOURCE: 1) Colorado School of Mines collection; 2) Mineral Resource Deposit Database Deposit ID 10024471, mine, M. Granitto
SAMPLE_DESC: Two samples; stringery mineralization and unmineralized quartz diorite; black, fine grain metamorphic(?) rock with white quartz vein containing scattered pyrrhotite and chalcopyrite grains; microscopic pyrrhotite well scattered throughout dark matrix; sulfide approx 20%

COLLECTION: Colorado School of Mines Ransome Collection
COORDINATES_SOURCE: 1) Colorado School of Mines collection; 2) Mineral Resource Deposit Database Deposit ID 10024471, mine, M. Granitto
SAMPLE_DESC: Two pieces; evolithic(?) mafic inclusions in quartz diorite (GP 15 mine scale); abundant plotches of pyrrhotite widely scattered throughout dark grey Al, Ca, Mg-silicate rock; chalcopyrite is thinly and widely scattered throughout rock; abundant clouds and isolated patches of magnetite also present; sulfide approx 40%

COLLECTION: Colorado School of Mines Ransome Collection

COLLECTION: Colorado School of Mines Ransome Collection

SAMPLE_DESC: High copper ore; Zn-Cu-Ag ore; one of ten samples from R.C. Bell, Inco Exploration, summer 1992; massive microcrystalline pyrrhotite mixed with chalcopyrite and sphalerite; maybe some arsenopyrite(?); the magnetism of the pyrrhotite appears to be too strong and may be inhanced by clouds of magnetite which are difficult to distinguish from other minerals in sample; sulfide approx 70%
